  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Opens the employee managing interface. Loads list of employees from the database on initialization.

    • onAddEmployee

      private void onAddEmployee(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

    • onCancel

      private void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles closing out of the employee managing interface
      Parameters:
      event - the JavaFX ActionEvent triggered by closing the form

    • onSubmitAddEmployee

      private void onSubmitAddEmployee(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Submits a new employee to the database. Validates input fields, inserts into DB, and updates the UI with the new employee button.
      Parameters:
      event - the JavaFX ActionEvent triggered by submitting the Add Employee form
      Throws:
      Exception - if database insertion fails

    • loadEmployeesFromDatabase

      private void loadEmployeesFromDatabase()
      Helper function for the database UO Accesses the database to load existing employees and render their buttons in the UI.
      Throws:
      Exception - if database insertion fails

    • openMainMenu

      Parameters:
      e - the JavaFX ActionEvent triggered

    • addEmployeeButtonToUI

      private void addEmployeeButtonToUI(int id, String name, String email, boolean isManager)
      Create and place a new Employee button in the grid. If an existing +Employee button is present, we will place the new employee where the + used to be and add a new + button after it (same row if space, otherwise on next row).

    • ensureAddButtonExists

      private void ensureAddButtonExists()
